class.name: VariantMap
class.description: A data structure which holds an arbitrary number of elements accessed via 2D coordinates. Each cell represents a single element which stores any [Variant] compatible datatype. Can act as a helper class for other pixel-based classes such as [Image], [BitMap] etc. The map is initialized with [method create] method: [codeblock] var map = VariantMap.new() map.create(3, 4) map.set_element(2, 3, "Goost") print(map.get_element(2, 3)) # Prints: "Goost". [/codeblock] Traversing all elements can be done just like two-dimensional array (or image): [codeblock] for y in map.get_height(): for x in map.get_width(): print(map.get_element(x, y)) [/codeblock] Alternatively, all elements can be traversed using a simplified syntax: [codeblock] for element in map: print(element) [/codeblock]

method.name: clear
method.description: Clears all elements in this map.

method.name: create
method.description: Initializes the map by allocating new data to hold [code]width * height[/code] elements. By default, all elements of the map are initialized to [code]null[/code] values. [b]Note:[/b] this clears all existing elements from the map before creation.

method.name: create_from_data
method.description: Initializes the map from a continuos 1D array of data. The number of elements in [code]data[/code] must be equal to [code]width * height[/code].

method.name: fill
method.description: Fills all elements in the map with a specified value.

method.name: get_cell
method.description: Similar to [method get_element], but accepts [Vector2] as coordinates.

method.name: get_cell_or_null
method.description: Returns cell's value if the map contains an element at specified position, otherwise returns [code]null[/code]. See also [method has_cell].

method.name: get_element
method.description: Returns an element at specified coordinates.

method.name: get_height
method.description: Returns the total number of rows.

method.name: get_size
method.description: Returns the map dimensions as [Vector2] (width and height).

method.name: get_width
method.description: Returns the total number of elements per row.

method.name: has_cell
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the map contains an element at specified position. Returns [code]false[/code] if the position lies outside the map dimensions. See also [method get_cell_or_null].

method.name: is_empty
method.description: Returns whether the map is empty (does not contain data).

method.name: resize
method.description: Resizes the map to have a different number of elements. Resizing an existing map to a smaller size rearranges the elements to fit new width and height without preserving original positions ([b]To-do:[/b] implement cropping method for this). Resizing an existing map to a larger size initializes new elements to [code]null[/code].

method.name: set_cell
method.description: Similar to [method set_element], but accepts [Vector2] as coordinates.

method.name: set_element
method.description: Sets any value to element at specified coordinates.

members.member: The data which represents this map. Used for storage.
